justification: The study operationalizes overtrust according to participants' following behaviors, specifically measuring how participants follow the robot's recommendations during the crisis simulation.
The VR system measures indices of information foraging, such as headset movement variability and eye tracking, which are used to explore potential determinants of overtrust.

measured_by: VR indices of threat-related autonomic arousal
justification: The VR system collects indices of threat-related autonomic arousal, including shifts in pupil dilation or grip strength, as potential determinants of overtrust.
Participants provide self-reports of their immersion levels on a 7-point Likert scale, which assesses how immersed they feel in the VR environment.

measured_by: willingness to trust the robot in future surveys
justification: Final surveys include ratings of the participants' willingness to trust the robot in the future, measured on a 7-point Likert scale.
Behavioral predictors of overtrust include percentage of time gazing at the robot, distance maintained to the robot, and exit looks, which are tracked and analyzed in the VR system.
